p:
To derive the expression for
R 0
, the basic pathogen reproductive number in vitro, we used Next Generation Matrix (NGM) techniques ( Diekmann et al., 1990; Heffernan et al., 2005), employing Wolfram Mathematica (version 11.2) as an analytical tool.
R
0
describes the number of new infections generated by an existing infection in a completely susceptible host population; a pathogen will invade a population when
R 0
> 1
Â ( Supplementary file 2). We then analyzed stability properties of the system, exploring dynamics across a range of parameter spaces, using MatCont (version 2.2) ( Dhooge et al., 2008) for Matlab (version R2018a) ( Supplementary file 3).
